author: Staff Reporter
text:
The MNREGS beneficiaries of the Madambakkam village panchayat unit have urged the government to increase the wages provided under the scheme for taking up construction projects, commensurate with the wages in the real estate market.

Participating in the special grama sabha meeting held at Madambakkam on Saturday, to audit the accounts of MNREGS works implemented in the village for the year 2014-15, the beneficiaries said the maximum wage offered under the scheme – Rs.183 day – for construction was far below the normal wages in real estate sector. They had also demanded that extended period of work – 150 days in a year – be implemented without fail and the wages to the beneficiaries for the works they had done for the past 90 days be released.

—staff reporter
title: Workers demand wage hike
